title: San Francisco Halloween Events
meta_description: There are a lot of Halloween activities in San Francisco and we thought we would share our favorites. Whether you are looking for something fun to do with your family or a fun adult night out, here are our suggestions to get in the Halloween spirit!
short_description: There are a lot of Halloween activities in San Francisco and we thought we would share our favorites. Whether you are looking for something fun to do with your family or a fun adult night out, here are our suggestions to get in the Halloween spirit!
long_description:
There are a lot of Halloween activities in San Francisco and we thought we would share our favorites. Whether you are looking for something fun to do with your family or a fun adult night out, here are our suggestions to get in the Halloween spirit!

 

Haunted House Dinner & Spooktacular Show at the Payne Mansion:

Friday, October 28 and Saturday, October 29

Two shows each night 7pm and 10pm

Purchase Tickets Here

San Francisco’s first “HAUNTED HOUSE” meets “POP-UP DINNER” returns! 4-Course Halloween-themed dining experience served by The Living Dead! Live Spooktacular Show! Eerie Singers, Ghostly Dancers, Freaky Contortionists & More! Located on Sutter and Franklin in Lower Pacific Heights, this is close to our Nob Hill Hotel.

Walking Dead on Fisherman’s Wharf

Saturday, October 29

9:00pm-2:00am

Dance the night away at this costume party at Roc Bar & NightClub with the Walking Dead. Enjoy the popular television show first hand.

Supernatural Halloween Party at the Academy of Sciences

Friday, October 28

5:30pm

Enjoy trick or treating through the popular Academy of Sciences, located in Golden Gate Park.

5th Annual Spooktacular Halloween Party

Sunday, October 30 from 1pm to 5pm

Free event for kids of all ages at the Japantown Peace Plaza

Mall wide trick-or-treating, games, decorations, arts, and crafts. Other activities include a bouncy house, face painting, and removable tattoos. Children in costume can trick-or-treat at both the East and West Malls and will receive candy and other special surprises

Clancy’s Pumpkin Patch

1620 7th Avenue

Want to visit a pumpkin patch right in the heart of San Francisco? Then head to Clancy’s Pumpkin Patch in the Inner Sunset district for pumpkins, hayrides and more! They are open 9am to 9pm through October 31st!
